name: Workspace File Reference
description: Tests if agent can reference and work with files mentioned earlier in conversation

turns.prompt: I have a project with these files: src/index.ts (entry point), src/utils/helpers.ts (utility functions), src/models/user.ts (User class), and package.json. The User class has properties: id, name, email, and a method validate().
turns.expectedBehavior: Acknowledges project structure, may ask clarifying questions about the project

turns.prompt: Add a new method to the User class called toJSON() that returns the user data as a plain object.
turns.expectedBehavior: Writes toJSON method for User class, references correct file path src/models/user.ts

turns.prompt: Now update the entry point to create a user, validate it, and log the JSON output.
turns.expectedBehavior: Updates src/index.ts, imports from correct paths, uses User class with validate() and new toJSON() methods

taskCompleted.description: toJSON method added to User class, index.ts updated with usage
taskCompleted.validation: Both code snippets provided with correct file references

contextRetained.description: Uses exact file paths from Turn 1, references User properties (id, name, email) and methods
contextRetained.validation: Code uses src/models/user.ts and src/index.ts, includes validate() call

codeWorks.description: TypeScript syntax valid, imports resolve correctly
codeWorks.validation: tsc compilation would pass (no syntax errors)
